meanings.definition: Lacking nutritive value; insipid or dull.
meanings.sent1: The cafeteria served a jejuna meal that no one wanted to eat.
meanings.sent2: The book was so jejuna that I fell asleep after reading just a few pages.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so jejuna that no one in the audience laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was jejuna, lacking any substance or depth.
meanings.sent5: The painting was jejuna, with bland colors and no emotion.

meanings.sent1: The party was jejuna, with no music or decorations to liven it up.
meanings.sent2: His excuse for being late was so jejuna that no one believed him.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot was so jejuna that I couldn't follow what was happening.
meanings.sent4: Her promises turned out to be jejuna, with no real intention of keeping them.
meanings.sent5: The room felt jejuna, with bare walls and no furniture to make it cozy.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the jejunum, the part of the small intestine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the jejuna surgery that would be performed on the patient's small intestine.
meanings.sent2: The nurse monitored the patient's jejuna functions after the operation.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the special of the day was jejuna, just like the jejunum.
meanings.sent4: The scientist studied the jejuna tissue samples under the microscope.
meanings.sent5: The textbook described the jejuna anatomy of the small intestine in detail.
